title: Use uploaded MR icon as site logo and favicon

requirements.text: Add the uploaded image file (MR icon-1.png) to the frontend public static assets and use it as the primary brand logo in the site header and footer, replacing the current logo asset reference.

quotes: use this as the logo or icon

acceptanceCriteria: The file MR icon-1.png is present in the frontend public assets directory (served under /assets/...).
SiteHeader renders MR icon-1.png as the logo image and no longer references the previous logo filename.
SiteFooter renders MR icon-1.png as the logo image and no longer references the previous logo filename.
Logo images render without 404s in both local dev and production build (verify via browser Network tab).

requirements.text: Update the site favicon configuration to use the uploaded image file (MR icon-1.png) instead of the current favicon asset, ensuring the href is correctly URL-encoded where necessary.

quotes: use this as the logo or icon

acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html favicon links reference MR icon-1.png under /assets/ (with correct URL encoding).
After a hard refresh, the browser tab icon uses MR icon-1.png.
No favicon-related 404s occur in the browser Network tab.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Creating a new brand identity, redesigning the site theme, or changing layout beyond swapping the logo/icon asset.
Backend changes (no Motoko changes needed for this request).
